abstract.p: Correction of August 13 travel article about islands in Lake Erie; article misstated Commodore Oliver Hazard Perry's famous message after 1813 Battle of Lake Erie, which was sent to Gen William Henry Harrison, who was not yet president (S)

block.p: An article on Aug. 13 about visiting islands in Lake Erie misstated the form of Commodore Oliver Hazard Perry's famous message after the Battle of Lake Erie in 1813, ''We have met the enemy, and they are ours,'' and misstated the title of the recipient. The message went by courier, not in a telegram. The addressee, William Henry Harrison, was a general and not yet president.
